H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H7194.def: = process by which separate objects being joined together to form one unit

H676.def: = one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H3871.def: = flat object with a smooth surface; ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for construction or decoration

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H269.def: = daughter of one's father, whether from the same mother or not; ≈ sometimes associated with affection; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H4129.def: = a person connected by blood or by marriage

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H5237.def: = state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective

H2505.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide an object (or range of objects) into portions; ► usually with the intention to use one or more of these portions for a particular purpose

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H2474.def: = an opening ◄ in the wall of a building, ► which admits light and often air to a room and allows its occupants to look out, or objects within to be seen; in some cases they can be opened and closed; sometimes used as secret entrance or exit; ≈ has therefore some connonations of secrecy

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H822.def: = window with bars or strips crossing each other with spaces left between

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6612.def: = person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H2638.def: = state in which humans lack something that they are supposed to have

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H681.def: relational indicating a location in the direct vicinity of the point of reference

H6438.def: = a place or angle where two or more sides or edges meet

H6805.def: = action by which humans put one foot before the other in order to move forward

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5399.def: = the time of day before the sun comes up and after the sun goes down

H6153.def: = the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H653.def: = state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and lack of wisdom

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H7122.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H5637.def: = state by which humans or animals stand up to or oppose the authority of a person or ruler or deity

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H6471.def: = the lower part of the leg beyond the ankle, on which humans or animals stand and with which they walk

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H693.def: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

H681.def: relational indicating a location in the direct vicinity of the point of reference

H6438.def: = a place or angle where two or more sides or edges meet

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H5401.def: = action with which a person touches her or his lips to another person (usually on the lips or cheek or hand) or to an object ► to show love or respect or devotion; also used when greeting and saying goodbye

H5810.def: = state in which humans or deities have the ability to exert force

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

14.gl: to put on a bold face

H2077.def: = the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and the other part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5088.def: = action by which humans make a solemn promise to a deity, ► which signals a commitment to perform a certain act or behave in a specific way, usually in return for a blessing from the deity

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7122.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H7836.def: = process by which the color of an object turns darker until it is (almost) black

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H7234.def: = causative action by which humans cover a bed or couch with a covering to prepare it for use

H6210.def: = a low platform standing on four legs, a bit longer than the length of a man, and about 70-80 centimeters wide

H4765.def: = relatively large piece of cloth ► used for covering a bed or couch

H2405.def: = cloth dyed with many different colors; ≈ considered beautiful

H330.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used to cover one's bed; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H5130.def: = action by which humans hold an object in their hands and move it to and fro, ► probably in order to signal to a deity that the object in their hands is intended for them

H4904.def: = state in which humans are lying down to rest

H4753.def: = the gum of a bush or shrub with thick thorny branches that project and bend at odd angles; its leaves come in sets of three; its fruit is oval like a plum; its wood and bark have a pleasant smell; the gum oozes naturally from the branches; clear or yellowish brown when it comes out, but gets darker as it dries; ◄ Commiphora myrrha, abyssinica, or schimperi; ► an ingredient of anointing oil and perfume; ≈ regarded as precious

H174.def: = large tree which may reach a height of 36 m.; native to south-east Asia and northern India; ◄ Aquilaria ahallocha (agarwood); ► known for its fragrant wood; ≈ associated with fragrance and beauty

H7076.def: = fragrant substance, ◄ made from the inner bark of the cinnamon tree ► and used for the preparation of perfume and anointing oil

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6872.def: = small container ◄ made of cloth; ► used to transport money, pack aromatic spices in order to put it between clothes, etc .; ≈ associated with possessions and treasures

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3677.def: = the day when the moon was in full shine; ≈ marked with religious celebrations

12.gl: to hold, carry, have (in one's luggage)

H3948.def: = causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H2506.def: = one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

H5080.def: = state in which one's hand, which holds an instrument like an axe, is raised ► with the purpose of striking it against another object

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H2874.def: = causative action by which humans kill animals by slicing the jugular vein and windpipe with a sharp-bladed instrument, ► to prepare its meat for a meal; ≈ associated with aggression

H191.def: = pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions

H5914.def: = ornament; ◄ made of metal; ► worn around the ankle

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2671.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment

H6398.def: = causative action by which humans use a sharp implement to split an object, either partially or completely

H3516.def: = state in which an object has relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H6833.def: = small bird, speckled brown in color; found in abundance around towns and settlements; lives on grass and grain; ◄ Passer domesticus, Passer hispaniolensis, and Passer moabiticus; ► clean and can therefore be eaten

H4116.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H6341.def: = contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7847.def: = action by which humans proceed along their way in a different direction than before

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H2491.def: = state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H6099.def: = state in which humans or animals are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H2315.def: = area enclosed by walls or partitions, floor, and ceiling; ◄ part of building

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living
